CatDescriptText: Miss Judy McNerney, typist, Millvale and Mr. N.A. Williams, accountant, Squirrel Hill were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1960, pg. A1  with question: "In your opinion what political party has done the most for the Negroes?" Miss Judy McNerney's answer reads: "Democrats, and the reason is that a lot of Democrats are Catholic, and Catholics are more tolerable."  Mr. N.A. Williams' answer reads: "Within the last four years, I would say that the Republicans have done the most.  Before that, however, Roosevelt had done more to help the Negro.  The Republicans today are working on all levels.  They have opened the eyes of the Democrats who now are doing what is right."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Judy McNerney wearing light colored shirt, carrying handbag, standing with arms crossed in front of stores, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of N.A. Williams wearing plaid necktie, standing in front of store windows, Smithfield Street, Downtown
